title: President of the European Central Bank - Wikipedia
snippet: Jean-Claude Trichet became president in 2003 and served during the European sovereign debt crisis. Trichet's strengths lay in keeping consensus and visible calm in the ECB. During his tenure, Trichet has had to fend off criticism from French President Nicolas Sarkozy who demanded a more ...

title: Christine Lagarde - President of the European Central Bank | LinkedIn
snippet: In July 2011 Christine Lagarde became the 11th Managing Director of the International Monetary Fund (IMF), and the first woman to hold that position. In February 2016 she was selected to serve a second five-year term.

title: Christine Lagarde - European Central Bank
snippet: Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank

title: Christine Lagarde - Wikipedia
snippet: On 2 July 2019, Christine Lagarde was nominated by the European Council to succeed Mario Draghi as President of the European Central Bank (ECB) on 1 November 2019.

title: Category:Presidents of the European Central Bank - Wikipedia
snippet: This category contains current and former presidents of the European Central Bank.
